sub_title: Green city, environmental and infrastructure management specialist
summary: Dr. Ogenis Brilhante (PhD. Environmental Science with honors) is senior consultant in environment, Infrastructure Management and Green city. Until recently he worked as Associated Professor and Lead specialist in infrastructure management and green city at IHS/Erasmus University (1999 to 2021). During this time he coordinated the UMD Master specialization “Infrastructure management and green city (IGC)”,  the professional short course "Green city for Eco Efficiency”  and  implemented as manager and consultant  more than 50 assignments in more than 25 developing and transitional countries working for different bilateral and multilateral agencies as well as governments and non-governmental organizations. His field of expertise also includes sustainable development, climate change, environmental planning and infrastructure management with a focus on energy, water, sanitation, and green infrastructure. He has published in peer review journals, supervised master and PhD thesis, and developed a green city concept including a tool to measure green city performance overtime (GCP),  http://www.mdpi.com/2071-1050/10/6/2031/pdf   and a method to develop a green city action plan using the results of GCP  tool. Currently, he works as consultant for his company called Green-Ogenis Consulting

education.degree_name: Doctor of Philosophy with honors - PhD

school.name: BA in Business Management State University of Ceara, Fortaleza, Brazil (1979-85)
IHE, Institute for Hydraulic and Environmental Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands

projects.title: Capacity building: Sustainable Tourism and Green Growth for Heritage Settlements of Kathmandu Valley. Nepal
projects.description: IHS manager of the UN Habitat Nepal project funded by EU  to provide training and consultancy on the rehabilitation of the Bungamati heritage settlement including infrastructure; green development (growth), sustainable tourism and local economic development. Outputs: 3 trainings delivered (green development, heritage and sustainable tourism); preparation of a report on  European experiences in green development and heritage settlements as sustainable tourism destination;  advisory on the reports "Green heritage settlement recovery policy and comprehensive heritage settlement recovery plan of Bungamanti prepared by UN Habitat Nepal.

contributors.headline: Green city, environmental and infrastructure management specialist

projects.title: Making Southern African cities greener in a time of climate change: Strategies to reduce water and food production vulnerabilities caused by water extremes (online training). Bloemfontein, South Africa
projects.description: Overall coordination and main lecturer of the training funded by Nuffic (Dutch government) and implemented online from Rotterdam to Azania Strategic Management Consultancy in Bloemfontein (South Africa) .  Tools developed by IHS and used in the training: Climate prior adaptation and Green city action plan. Outputs: 1- Five water extremes hazards identified in three selected cities of the region; 2- Ten vulnerabilities identified for selected hazards and for each city and chosen sector; 3-One simplified green action plan per city containing two strategies to reduce vulnerabilities of the studied sectors with each strategy composed of five actions including three actions focused on green approaches lectured in the course

 2- Two time Lecturer and expert on Planning and Design of Urban Space using green city and green infrastructure approach  for  the Environmental Technology Department (Wageningen University):  (March 2021 and 2022.)

contributors.headline: Green city, environmental and infrastructure management specialist

projects.title: Professional course on Green cities for Eco-efficiency. Rotterdam
projects.description: Development and implementation of the three weeks annual course implemented at IHS. Overall coordination, organization of the practical field visits and main lecturer. The course is developed and organized around the IHS-Green City Concept Framework, (IHS-GCCF), developed by Dr. Brilhante.  Main topics lectured:  green city concept and approaches, energy efficiency, green growth, green transport, renewable energy, green infrastructure, vertical farm and food production. Outputs: calculate the green performance of a city using the IHS-GCCF tool and apply these results to develop a green city action plan using the IHS-GCAP tool.

contributors.headline: Green city, environmental and infrastructure management specialist

projects.title: Capacity building: Training on drinking water provision and management for Communities and Utility companies in Liberia (online course). Monrovia
projects.description: Training funded by Comic Relief  and Cities Alliance for the Liberian Government organizations. The activities consisted of the coordination, implementation, and preparation of training program and three key documents prior the beginning of training:  a Guide and instructions to prepare a community Drinking Water Service Management Plan (DWSMP); a Community Drinking Water Management Manual; and an Action Planning Workbook. Outputs: 1-A Drinking Water Service Management Plan (DWSMP) for one community drinking water system and another for Monrovia Drinking water company; 2-An action plan containing actions to implement the prepared DWSMP focused on drinking water governance, access and management systems..

contributors.headline: Green city, environmental and infrastructure management specialist

projects.title: Evaluation of the Water Monitoring and Flow Forecasting System project implemented in the Niger River Basin Authority (NBA) (ORIO10/NE/22). Niamey, Niger
projects.description: Evaluation implemented for the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs/Erasmus University in Niamey, Niger and countries of the Niger basin. The evaluation consisted or using the the theory of changes structured along six evaluation criteria: efficiency, effectiveness, sustainability, relevance, additionality and policy coherence. Preparation of case a case study including desk study, field visit, interviews and a final report

projects.title: The urban expansion and compact city debate in the context of Mozambique: research project. Nampula, Mozambique
projects.description: Conduct a research and prepare a report for the city alliance on the impacts of the urban expansion, climate change and the adoption of some practices of compact city  on the local development of the city of Nampula, Mozambique.

contributors.headline: Green city, environmental and infrastructure management specialist

projects.title: Capacity building. Green Home- Promoting Sustainable Housing in Nepal: sustainable Consumption and Production of green products for the Nepali housing sector. Kathmandu and other cities of Nepal
projects.description:
Senior IHS manager, advisor, researcher and trainer for EU funded project  implemented in Kathmandu, Pokhara and Dharan by UN-Habitat Nepal. The outputs and activities included: coordination, preparation and implementation of three trainings: green buildings, sustainable energy and green development, and preparation of four reports/manuals: European Experiences of Building Codes for Promoting Sustainable Housing; Review of some incentive mechanisms in European municipalities to promote sustainable housing; Manual on green Labels, certification systems and green procurement; Manual on promoting and marketing green products and services: energy, materials, water and 
 wastewater. Conduct a research and preparation of a report on the identification of the green products used and produced by the Nepali building sector. Publication of an article with the results of the research.

projects.title: Strengthening Curriculum Development and Knowledge on Pro-active Urban Flood Disaster Management for KPI: TOT course. Bangkok, Thailand
projects.description: Coordinator and main lecture of the Tailor Made Training funded by Nuffic (Dutch government) to the  KPI. King Prajadhipok's Institute, Bangkok, Thailand. Outputs and activities included: overall coordination, preparation of the program, field visits,  lectures on disaster risk management, climate change adaptation strategies, green infrastructure and flooding,  and of a Training of Trainers (TOT) manual to be used in the course.

projects.title: Capacity Building in Disaster Risk Management for Malawi. Lilongwe and Salima, Malawi; Maputo, Mozambique
projects.description: Program funded by the World Bank and implemented in Lilongwe, Salima (Malawi) and Maputo (Mozambique) for the staff or the Department of Disaster Management Affairs of Malawi (DoDMA). Overall coordination, program and curriculum development including a week TOT training, lecturer on climate change and disaster risk management issues. Organization and facilitator of a field visit to Maputo (Mozambique) for a delegation of 10 directors and commissioners from several Malawi ministries to visit the local flood warning systems alert system

contributors.headline: Green city, environmental and infrastructure management specialist

projects.title: Capacity Building on Local and Regional Economic Development Program for Indonesia LEDs 4,5,6 and REDS 1 & 2. Several cities in Indonesia
projects.description: Annual program funded by the Dutch government for Bappenas, Indonesia. Program conducted the first  part in the Nethelands and  the second part in different cities of Indonesia. The aim of the program was to training local private and public servicers of Indonesia cities on local economic development (LED) and on Regional economic development (RED). Coordination and main lecturer on LED and RED subjects. Main output development of a local action plan for each trained city using a local product chosen by the city partipants. Indonesia cities where the LED program was implemented:  2006:  Batu Malan; 2007: Kendari, Gorontalo. 2008: Thousand islands (Kepulaun Seribu) Java, Luwu/Makassar (Sulawesi), Borobudur Magelan, Java. 2009: Lima Phulo Kota (Sumatra), Muna Island (Sulawesi). Cities where the RED program was implemented: REDs 1: Rotterdam, Jakarta, Bantul (Java), Tana Toraja (Sulawesi) and Mataran (Lombok) and REDs 2:Purworejo, Jepara and Kunigan (Java, Jakarta)

contributors.headline: Green city, environmental and infrastructure management specialist

projects.title: Tailor made program: Environmental Audit-Mining sector. Rotterdam and Jakarta, Indonesia
projects.description: Program funded by the Indonesian and Dutch governments for the Indonesian Supreme Audit Court.  Overall coordination, program and curriculum development, lecture, organization of the field visits and seminars. Coordinator of the development of an environmental audit manual for the mining sector in Indonesia, BPK, Jakarta. Topics lectured: Sustainable development and natural resources,  Environmental quality, environmental impacts and mitigations measures of the mining sector (coal mining), Strategic Environmental Assessment for mining policies and plans (SEA), good management practices for the mining sector (ISO 14 000), closing and rehabilitation of old mines (land use and mitigation measures), environmental liability.

profile_positions.description: Consulting, education, research and management  services related to green cities, sustainable development, conservation, climate change (green) infrastructure, energy, water, sanitation and similar issues
profile_positions.title: Lead Specialist in  infrastructure management and green city

company.name: IHS Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies, Erasmus University Rotterdam

profile_positions.company: IHS Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies
profile_positions.description: 22 years of experience as Senior Expert in Environment Planning, Green City, and Infrastructure Management. Some positions held at IHS: Associated professor and head of the Green city and Infrastructure thematic group; Coordinator of the Infrastructure and green city specialization of the IHS Master program and diverse short professional courses such as green city for eco efficiency and urban management tools for climate change ; Lecturer, researcher, acqusition of projects, formulation of proposals and consultant for bilateral and multilateral agencies, governments and non-governmental organizations on the following fields: green city,  green building, environmental planning and quality, management of water/sanitation infrastructure, green infrastructure and flooding, disaster risk management and Climate change, sustainable energy, sustainable development and urbanization. Thesis supervisor and publication of books and articles in scientific journals
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor and Senior specialist in environment, infrastructure and green city.
